author: Reuters Editorial
title: Canada's Trudeau says feeling positive about NAFTA talks
text:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Thursday said he felt positive about talks to update the NAFTA trade pact, which U.S. officials say need to be wrapped up very quickly for the current Congress to vote on a final text.
Canada's Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks to the Economic Club of New York in New York, U.S., May 17, 2018. REUTERS/Lucas Jackson “There is a good deal on the table ... it’s right down to the last conversations,” Trudeau told the Economic Club of New York, saying that senior Canadian officials were in the United States for talks on the negotiations.
Reporting by Jonathan Spicer, writing by David Ljunggren; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama
